com.blukii.sdk.config

Class Blukii

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.blukii.sdk.config.Blukii
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SmartBeacon, SmartKey, SmartSensor

    public class Blukii
extends java.lang.Object

    Main controller class for connection based communication with blukii devices.

    Blukii is a single point of contact for all actions that are provided by blukii GATT profiles.

    Quick start documentation

    blukii types

    This class contains all blukii functions that are independent of any blukii type.

    For each blukii type there is a derived class that contains additional type specific functions and callbacks:
    • SmartBeacon

    • SmartKey

    • SmartSensor


    Note: With the help of reading the firmware you can identify the blukii type. See Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onReadDeviceFirmware(String, byte) for more information.



    Get blukii device object

    Initially, you need a valid blukii device (BluetoothDevice) to connect to.

    You have to search for BLE devices that can easily be done by the BlukiiClient class, that is part of this library's info package.

    The (BluetoothDevice) object you can retrieve by calling DiscoveryData.getDevice().



    Connect blukii device

    Call connect(OnConnectionListener) to initiate the connection: 
      

      private boolean connectDevice() {

          // get blukii device object from an OutputElement, that is retrieved from BlukiiClient.OnDiscoveryListener
          bluetoothDevice = outputElement.getDiscoveryData().getDevice();

          // create new Blukii instance
          mBlukii = new Blukii(context, bluetoothDevice);

          // initiate connection => retrieve callback via Blukii.OnConnectionListener
          mBlukii.connect(onBlukiiConnectionListener);

      }

      private final Blukii.OnConnectionListener onBlukiiConnectionListener = new Blukii.OnConnectionListener() {

           @Override
          public void onConnected() {
               // Connection successful
          }

           @Override
          public void onConnectionFailed() {
              // Connection failed
          }

          ...

      });




    Asynchronous requests

    This class contains a large set of requests that are supported of the blukii device.

    Important: all requests are called asynchronously. The results are returned via callbacks of Blukii.OnConnectionListener.

    All requests are following this rules:
    • For each read... request (e.g. readBluetoothTxPower() the corresponding callback onRead... (e.g. Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onReadBluetoothTxPower(short, byte) is called, containing all relevant response data.

    • For each write... request (e.g. writeBluetoothTxPower(short) the corresponding callback onWrite... (e.g. Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onWriteBluetoothTxPower(byte) is called, containing the response status.




      

      private void readAndWriteTxPower() {

          mBlukii.writeBluetoothTxPower(0);
          mBlukii.readBluetoothTxPower();

      }


      private final Blukii.OnConnectionListener onBlukiiConnectionListener = new Blukii.OnConnectionListener() {

           @Override
          public void onWrite(String request, byte status) {

              switch (request) {
                  case Blukii.ACTION_BLUETOOTH_CONFIGURE_TXPOWER:
                      if(status == Blukii.REQUEST_STATUS_SUCCESS) {
                          Log.i(TAG, "writeBluetoothTxPower successful");
                      } else {
                          Log.e(TAG, "writeBluetoothTxPower failed with error: " + status);
                      }
                  break;
              }
          }

           @Override
          public void onReadBluetoothTxPower(short value, byte status) {
              if(status == Blukii.REQUEST_STATUS_SUCCESS) {
                  // request readBluetoothTxPower successful
                  Log.i(TAG, "readBluetoothTxPower successful, value: " + value);
              } else {
                  // request readBluetoothTxPower failed
                  Log.e(TAG, "readBluetoothTxPower failed with error: " + status);
              }
          }

          ...

      });




    Command sets

    Not all requests are supported by every blukii. It depends on blukii hardware, type and firmware version.

    It is recommended to detect the available command set first, before calling any request:

    • readBluetoothCommandSet(): detect availability for all readBluetooth... and writeBluetooth... requests.

    • readBlukiiCommandSet(): detect availability for all readBlukii... and writeBlukii... requests.

    • readSensorCommandSet(): detect availability for all readSensor... and writeSensor... requests.

        Parameters:
        context - a valid context that must not be null

        See Also:
        BlukiiClient, BlukiiClient.startDiscovery(), BlukiiClient.OnDiscoveryListener, DiscoveryData.getDevice()

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public boolean connect(Blukii.OnConnectionListener onConnectionListener)
        Initiates a connection to the GATT server hosted on the blukii device.

        The parameter "onConnectionListener" contains the listener for all requests that will be called during connection. See class Blukii.OnConnectionListener

        Note: if you want to call requests of a derived blukii typed class (SmartBeacon, SmartKey or SmartSensor) you have to instantiate the OnConnectionListener (see SmartBeacon.OnConnectionListener, SmartKey.OnConnectionListener or SmartSensor.OnConnectionListener) of the derived class!

        If this action has finished, callback Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onConnected() or Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onConnectionFailed() is called.

        Parameters:
        onConnectionListener - OnConnectionLister of this or derived class
        Returns:
        true if the connection is initiated successfully.

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Disconnects the connected blukii or cancel a pending connection.

        If this action has finished, callback Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onDisconnected() is called.

      • getBluetoothDevice

        public android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice getBluetoothDevice()
        Gets the Bluetooth device that has been set on instantiation
        Returns:
        actual Bluetooth Device
        See Also:
        Blukii(Context, BluetoothDevice)

      • isReady

        public boolean isReady()
        Check whether it is ready for configuration
        Returns:
        true if ready, false otherwise.

      • readBluetoothAdvertisingChannels

        public void readBluetoothAdvertisingChannels()
        Reads the advertising channels that are used for the Bluetooth advertising.

        See writeBluetoothAdvertisingChannels(boolean, boolean, boolean) for more information.

        The response data is returned on callback Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onReadBluetoothAdvertisingChannels(boolean, boolean, boolean, byte).

        This request is not supported for SmartBeacon.

      • readBluetoothAdvertisingUpdateDelay

        public void readBluetoothAdvertisingUpdateDelay()
        Reads the advertising update delay (in seconds).

        See writeBluetoothAdvertisingUpdateDelay(int) for more information.

        The response data is returned on callback Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onReadBluetoothAdvertisingUpdateDelay(int, byte).

        This request is not supported for SmartBeacon.

      • readBluetoothCommandSet

        public void readBluetoothCommandSet()

        The response data is returned on callback Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onReadBluetoothCommandSet(int, byte).

        See Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onReadBluetoothCommandSet(int, byte) for more information.

        The response data is returned on callback Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onReadBluetoothConnectionParameterDelay(int, byte).

        This request is not supported for SmartBeacon.

        The response data is returned on callback Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onReadBluetoothDelayedDisconnect(int, byte).

        This request is not supported for SmartBeacon.

      • readBluetoothInitialAdvertisingInterval

        public void readBluetoothInitialAdvertisingInterval()
        Reads the initial advertising interval (in milliseconds) that is active after reboot and disconnection.

        See writeBluetoothInitialAdvertisingInterval(int) for more information.

        The response data is returned on callback Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onReadBluetoothInitialAdvertisingInterval(int, byte) .

      • readBluetoothLimitedAdvertising

        public void readBluetoothLimitedAdvertising()

        See writeBluetoothLimitedAdvertising(int) for more information.

        The response data is returned on callback Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onReadBluetoothLimitedAdvertising(int, byte) .

      • readBluetoothTxPower

        public void readBluetoothTxPower()
        Reads the Bluetooth TxPower strength.

        See writeBluetoothTxPower(short) TxPower(int)} for more information.

        The response data is returned on callback Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onReadBluetoothTxPower(short, byte) .

      • readBlukiiCommandSet

        public void readBlukiiCommandSet()
        Reads the availability of requests concerning blukii settings.

        The response data is returned on callback Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onReadBlukiiCommandSet(int, byte).

        See Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onReadBlukiiCommandSet(int, byte) for more information.

      • readBlukiiRebootCounter

        public void readBlukiiRebootCounter()
        Reads the amount of reboots that has been occured after the counter reset by writeBlukiiRebootCounterReset().

        You can use this information to verify if there has been some unscheduled reboots.

        The response data is returned on callback Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onReadBlukiiRebootCounter(int, byte) .

        This request is not supported for SmartBeacon.

      • readBlukiiRTC

        public void readBlukiiRTC()
        Reads the actual time of the blukii's real time clock.

        The real time clock is needed for the use of the daytime function of type SmartBeacon, that can be configured with SmartBeacon.writeSmartBeaconSettings(int, int, int, int, int, int).

        Note: the real time clock will be reset to date/time 1/1/2000 00:00 when blukii is rebooted. Call writeBlukiiRTCSync() for setting to actual date/time.

        The response data is returned on callback Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onReadBlukiiRTC(Calendar, byte) .

        This request is not supported for SmartKey.

      • readDeviceFirmware

        public void readDeviceFirmware()
        Reads the blukii device firmware.

        With the help of reading the firmware you can identify the blukii type. See Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onReadDeviceFirmware(String, byte) for more information.

        The response data is returned on callback Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onReadDeviceFirmware(String, byte).

      • readSensorCommandSet

        public void readSensorCommandSet()
        Reads the availability of requests concerning sensor settings.

        The response data is returned on callback Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onReadSensorCommandSet(int, byte).

        See Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onReadSensorCommandSet(int, byte) for more information.

      • readSensorTemperature

        public void readSensorTemperature()
        Reads the calibrated value of the temperature sensor.

        See writeSensorTemperature(float) for more information.

        The response data is returned on callback Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onReadSensorTemperature(float, byte) .

        This request is not supported for SmartKey.

      • writeBluetoothAdvertisingChannels

        public void writeBluetoothAdvertisingChannels(boolean channel1,
                                              boolean channel2,
                                              boolean channel3)
        Writes the advertising channels that are used for the Bluetooth advertising.

        The request status is returned on callback Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onWriteBluetoothAdvertisingChannels(byte).

        This request is not supported for SmartBeacon.
        Parameters:
        channel1 - true, if channel 1 is advertising
        channel2 - true, if channel 2 is advertising
        channel3 - true, if channel 3 is advertising
        See Also:
        readBluetoothAdvertisingChannels()

      • writeBluetoothAdvertisingUpdateDelay

        public void writeBluetoothAdvertisingUpdateDelay(int delay)
        Writes the advertising update delay (in seconds).

        After the advertising update delay, the initial advertising interval (see readBluetoothInitialAdvertisingInterval() is changing to the delayed advertising interval (see readBluetoothDelayedAdvertisingInterval().

        Value range:
        0 - 65535s

        Note: if this value is 0, the initial advertising interval stays active without changing.

        The request status is returned on callback Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onWriteBluetoothAdvertisingUpdateDelay(byte).

        This request is not supported for SmartBeacon.
        Parameters:
        delay - advertising update delay (in seconds)
        See Also:
        readBluetoothAdvertisingUpdateDelay(), readBluetoothInitialAdvertisingInterval(), readBluetoothDelayedAdvertisingInterval()

      • writeBluetoothConnectionParameterDelay

        public void writeBluetoothConnectionParameterDelay(int delay)
        Writes the connection parameter delay (in seconds).

        After the connection parameter delay, the initial connection parameters (defined by the connected master device} are changing to the delayed connection parameters (see readBluetoothDelayedConnectionParameter().

        Value range:
        0 - 65535s

        Note: if this value is 0, the initial connection parameters stay active without changing.

        The request status is returned on callback Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onWriteBluetoothConnectionParameterDelay(byte).

        This request is not supported for SmartBeacon.
        Parameters:
        delay - connection parameter delay (in seconds)
        See Also:
        readBluetoothConnectionParameterDelay(), readBluetoothConnectionParameterDelay(), readBluetoothCurrentConnectionParameter()

      • writeBluetoothCurrentConnectionParameter

        public void writeBluetoothCurrentConnectionParameter(int intervalMin,
                                                     int intervalMax,
                                                     int latency,
                                                     int timeout)
        Writes the current parameter set for the connection for a immediate change of the connection parameters.

        Value ranges:
        intervalMin: 10 - 4000ms
        intervalMax: 10 - 4000ms
        latency: 0 - 499ms
        timeout: 100 - 32000ms

        The request status is returned on callback Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onWriteBluetoothCurrentConnectionParameter(byte).
        Parameters:
        intervalMin - maximum interval in milliseconds
        intervalMax - minimum interval in milliseconds
        latency - latency in milliseconds
        timeout - timeout (until disconnect) in milliseconds
        See Also:
        readBluetoothCurrentConnectionParameter(), readBluetoothDelayedConnectionParameter(), readBluetoothConnectionParameterDelay()

      • writeBluetoothDelayedAdvertisingInterval

        public void writeBluetoothDelayedAdvertisingInterval(int interval)
        Writes the delayed advertising interval (in milliseconds).

        The initial advertising interval (see readBluetoothInitialAdvertisingInterval() is changing to the delayed advertising interval after the advertising update delay (see readBluetoothAdvertisingUpdateDelay(). It stays active until the blukii is rebooted (switched off) or getting a new connection.

        Value range:
        100 - 10000ms
        steps of 100 ms between 100 and 2500
        steps of 2500 between 2500 and 10000ms
        values between this steps will be rounded down

        The request status is returned on callback Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onWriteBluetoothDelayedAdvertisingInterval(byte) (String, byte)}.

        This request is not supported for SmartBeacon.
        Parameters:
        interval - delayed advertising interval (in milliseconds)
        See Also:
        readBluetoothDelayedAdvertisingInterval(), readBluetoothInitialAdvertisingInterval(), readBluetoothAdvertisingUpdateDelay()

      • writeBluetoothDelayedConnectionParameter

        public void writeBluetoothDelayedConnectionParameter(int intervalMin,
                                                     int intervalMax,
                                                     int latency,
                                                     int timeout)
        Writes the delayed parameter set for the connection.

        The initial connection parameters (defined by the connected master device} are changing to the delayed connection parameters after the connection parameter delay (see readBluetoothConnectionParameterDelay(). It stays active until the blukii is disconnected.

        Value ranges:
        intervalMin: 10 - 4000ms
        intervalMax: 10 - 4000ms
        latency: 0 - 499ms
        timeout: 100 - 32000ms

        The request status is returned on callback Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onWriteBluetoothDelayedConnectionParameter(byte).

        This request is not supported for SmartBeacon.
        Parameters:
        intervalMin - maximum interval in milliseconds
        intervalMax - minimum interval in milliseconds
        latency - latency in milliseconds
        timeout - timeout (until disconnect) in milliseconds
        See Also:
        readBluetoothDelayedConnectionParameter(), readBluetoothConnectionParameterDelay(), readBluetoothCurrentConnectionParameter()

      • writeBluetoothDelayedDisconnect

        public void writeBluetoothDelayedDisconnect(int delay)
        Writes the time (in seconds) until the blukii will trigger the disconnection.

        Value range: 0-3600 seconds; -1: on disconnect will be triggered

        The request status is returned on callback Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onWriteBluetoothDelayedDisconnect(byte).

        This request is not supported for SmartBeacon.
        Parameters:
        delay - seconds after blukii will disconnect
        See Also:
        readBluetoothDelayedDisconnect()

      • writeBluetoothInitialAdvertisingInterval

        public void writeBluetoothInitialAdvertisingInterval(int interval)
        Writes the initial advertising interval (in milliseconds) that is active after disconnection.

        Value range:
        100 - 10000ms
        steps of 100 ms between 100 and 2500
        steps of 2500 between 2500 and 10000ms
        values between this steps will be rounded down

        The request status is returned on callback Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onWriteBluetoothInitialAdvertisingInterval(byte).
        Parameters:
        interval - initial advertising interval (in milliseconds)
        See Also:
        readBluetoothInitialAdvertisingInterval(), readBluetoothDelayedAdvertisingInterval(), readBluetoothAdvertisingUpdateDelay()

      • writeBluetoothLimitedAdvertising

        public void writeBluetoothLimitedAdvertising(int delay)
        Writes the limited advertising delay (in seconds) after pushing the blukii button.

        Value range:
        0: limited advertising is off: unlimited advertising.
        1 - 1800s: the blukii is advertising (connectable frames) for the defined delay after the blukii button has been pushed.

        Note: After re-inserting the battery the advertising is always active for at least 30 seconds!

        The request status is returned on callback Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onWriteBluetoothLimitedAdvertising(byte).

        This request is only supported for blukii SmartKeys that's hardware includes a push button.
        Parameters:
        delay - limited advertising delay (in seconds)
        See Also:
        readBluetoothLimitedAdvertising()

      • writeBluetoothTxPower

        public void writeBluetoothTxPower(short value)
        Writes the Bluetooth TxPower strength.

        Value range: defined values between -21 and 5 dBm, see constant array SETTING_BLUETOOTH_TXPOWER_VALUES

        The request status is returned on callback Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onWriteBluetoothTxPower(byte).

        This request is not supported for the SmartBeacon type "Eddystone". There you have to use SmartBeacon.writeEddystoneTxPowerMode(int) instead.
        Parameters:
        value - TxPower value in dBm
        See Also:
        readBluetoothTxPower()

      • writeBlukiiFactoryReset

        public void writeBlukiiFactoryReset()
        Initiates the factory reset for the blukii device.

        The blukii will be disconnected and reset to factory settings.

        Note: this request is only available in service mode that is running 30 seconds after re-inserting the battery.

        The request status is returned on callback Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onWriteBlukiiFactoryReset(byte).

      • writeBlukiiInitiatePairing

        public void writeBlukiiInitiatePairing()
        Initiates a pairing request from the blukii to the master device.

        Initially, the request status is returned on callback Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onWriteBlukiiInitiatePairing(byte).

        If blukii is paired already the master device shows the pairing request as dialog or notification. If the pairing key is typed in correctly the success status will be notified on callback Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onNotifyBlukiiInitiatePairing(boolean, byte).

        This request is only supported for SmartKey.

      • writeBlukiiLEDMode

        public void writeBlukiiLEDMode(int mode,
                               int count)
        Activates/deactivates the blukii's LED.

        You have to define the mode (off, blink or permanent) and the amount of blinks or time.

        The request status is returned on callback Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onWriteBlukiiLEDMode(byte).

        This request is only supported for SmartKey.
        Parameters:
        mode - LED mode (available values: SETTING_BLUKII_LED_OFF, SETTING_BLUKII_LED_FLASH_1000, SETTING_BLUKII_LED_FLASH_300, SETTING_BLUKII_LED_FLASH_50, SETTING_BLUKII_LED_ON_SECONDS or SETTING_BLUKII_LED_ON_MINUTES
        count - amount of blinks or time

      • writeBlukiiReboot

        public void writeBlukiiReboot()
        Initiates the reboot of the blukii device.

        The blukii will be disconnected before reboot.

        The request status is returned on callback Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onWriteBlukiiReboot(byte).

      • writeBlukiiRebootCounterReset

        public void writeBlukiiRebootCounterReset()
        Resets the blukii's reboot counter.

        See readBlukiiRebootCounter() for more information.

        The request status is returned on callback Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onWriteBlukiiRebootCounterReset(byte).

        This request is not supported for SmartBeacon.

      • writeBlukiiRTCSync

        public void writeBlukiiRTCSync()
        Sets the blukii's real time clock to actual time.

        The actual time is read from the master device.

        See readBlukiiRTC() for more information.

        The request status is returned on callback Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onWriteBlukiiRTCSync(byte).

        This request is not supported for SmartKey.

      • writeSensorTemperature

        public void writeSensorTemperature(float temperature)
        Writes the actual sensor temperature.

        Use this function to calibrate the blukii's temperature sensor

        Value range:
        -3.276,7 - +3.267,7 °C (step: 0,1 °C)

        Sensor offset reset: you can reset the temperature sensor to default by setting Float.MIN_VALUE as temperature value.

        The request status is returned on callback Blukii.OnConnectionListener.onWriteSensorTemperature(byte).

        This request is not supported for SmartKey.
        Parameters:
        temperature - temperature value in °C
        See Also:
        readSensorTemperature()
